Module chav1961.purelib
Package chav1961.purelib.fsys

Class AbstractFileSystem

java.lang.Object
chav1961.purelib.fsys.AbstractFileSystem
All Implemented Interfaces:
SpiService<FileSystemInterface>, FileSystemInterface, java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractNanoServiceFileSystem, FileSystemInMemory, FileSystemOnClassLoader, FileSystemOnFile, FileSystemOnFileSystem, FileSystemOnRMI, FileSystemOnXMLReadOnly
public abstract class AbstractFileSystem
extends java.lang.Object
implements FileSystemInterface

This abstract class implements the most of all FileSystemInterface functionality.

You can use this class as a basic class for your own file system implementations. To use it, you need override the three methods:

  • canServe(URI) method to test URI scheme this file system implementation can serve (see FileSystemFactory)
  • clone() method to make a quick copy of the file system instance
  • createDataWrapper(URI) method to get direct access to the file system entity.

As a good example, see FileSystemOnFile class implementation.

Don't use the class as a type of variables or parameters in your program. Use the FileSystemInterface interface instead in all cases

This class is not thread-safe.

Since:
0.0.1
Author:
Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
See Also:
FileSystemInterface, FileSystemOnFile, JUnit tests
LastUpdate:
0.0.3

      public FileSystemInterface unjoin() throws java.io.IOException
      Description copied from interface: FileSystemInterface

      Specified by:
      unjoin in interface FileSystemInterface
      Returns:

      encoding - source content encoding
      Returns:
      input stream to get access to the file content. You need close this stream after processing, so let's use it in the try-with-resource statement
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if any exceptions was thrown
